com.github.pocketkid2.math

Class Combinatorics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.pocketkid2.math.Combinatorics

  • public class Combinatorics
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Adam This class contains methods calculating simple combinatorics formula. Currently there are 5 methods and they are as follows: Factorial, the base of all the other calculations. The other four methods calculate the answer to the following counting question in different ways: "How many ways are there to select K objects from N distinct objects?"

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Combinatorics()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Combinatorics

        public Combinatorics()

    • Method Detail

      • factorial

        public static long factorial(long n)
        This method calculates the value of N times all the numbers less than it down to one. This is called N factorial, or N!. It is defined recursively. Valid entries are positive integers. Any values less than zero will be returned.
        Parameters:
        n - The value of N to calculate for, a positive integer.
        Returns:
        The value of N factorial, or the parameter if it is less than 2

      • sequence

        public static long sequence(int n,
                            int k)
        The first of the four basic combinatorics counting questions. This calculates the answer to the question where ORDER MATTERS and REPETITION IS ALLOWED. This is known as a sequence, and is very simply, N to the power of K.
        Parameters:
        n - The value of N. Must be a positive integer
        k - The value of K. Must be a positive integer.
        Returns:
        N to the power of K, which is the answer to the question.

      • arrangement

        public static long arrangement(int n,
                               int k)
        The second of the four basic combinatorics counting questions. It calculates the answer where ORDER MATTERS and REPETITION IS NOT ALLOWED. This is known as an arrangement, and can be defined and calculated with factorials.
        Parameters:
        n - The value of N. Must be a positive integer.
        k - The value of K. This must be less than or equal to N, and must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        The answer to the question.

      • subset

        public static long subset(int n,
                          int k)
        The third of the four basic combinatorics counting questions. It calculates the answer where ORDER DOES NOT MATTER and REPETITION IS NOT ALLOWED. This is called a subset, and is defined with factorials, as an extension of the second question above. The answer is also known as "N choose K".
        Parameters:
        n - The value of N. Must be a positive integer.
        k - The value of K. This must be less than or equal to N, and must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        The answer to the question

      • multisubset

        public static long multisubset(int n,
                               int k)
        The last of the four basic combinatorics counting questions. It calculates the answer where ORDER DOES NOT MATTER but REPETITION IS ALLOWED. It is an extension of the question above, and is also known as "N multichoose K".
        Parameters:
        n - The value of N. Must be a positive integer.
        k - The value of K. Must be zero or greater.
        Returns:
        The answer to the question.
